content_sections.content: Example Wrap a string into new lines when it reaches a specific length: \n"); ?> Definition and Usage The wordwrap() function wraps a string into new lines when it reaches a specific length. Note: This function may leave white spaces at the beginning of a line. Syntax wordwrap( string,width,break,cut ) Parameter Values Parameter Description string Required. Specifies the string to break up into lines width Optional. Specifies the maximum line width. Default is 75 break Optional. Specifies the characters to use as break. Default is "\n" cut Optional. Specifies whether words longer than the specified width should be wrapped: FALSE - Default. No-wrap TRUE - Wrap Technical Details Return Value: Returns the string broken into lines on success, or FALSE on failure.
